intro: Phlogacanthus abbreviatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed phlogacanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Loganiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
